proof:
Proof. Consider arbitrary $F \in B_1$. As we saw in Case 0 of the proof of Lemma 53, the number of singleton components in $(V_C, F)$ is at most $(1 - \frac{2\eta}{3})n$. Let $S$ be the set of vertices that are in components of size $\ge 2$.
Note that the edges of $F$ have all endpoints in $S$, thus $|F| \le e_G(S)$. Combining Lemmas 29, 30 (with $R$ being the $k$ from the previous lemma) and 35, we get for all $d$ large enough, whp, for any connected subset $S' \subseteq S$ of $(V_C, F)$, $e_G(S') \le |S'|(1+\max(1, d\eta/3))$. Hence, $e_G(S) \le |S|(2+d\eta/3)$. Since $e_G(S) \ge |F| \ge \frac{9\eta}{10}|E_C|$, we must have $|S| \ge \frac{9\eta|E_C|}{10d(\eta/3+2/d)}$. Since each component containing $|S|$ has at least 2 vertices, $c(F) \le n - |S| + |S|/2 = n - |S|/2$. Therefore we can bound
$$ \frac{w_G(F)}{w_G(\emptyset)} = q^{n-\frac{|S|}{2} - n_C}(e^\beta-1)^{|F|} \ge q^{2n - \frac{8\eta|E_C|}{10d(\eta/3+2/d)} - n_C} (e^{\beta_1}-1)^{\eta|E_C|} $$
where the last inequality follows from $\beta \ge \beta_1$ and that whp $n_C \le n(1-e^{-d/3})$. For all $q$ large enough $\frac{9}{2(\eta/3+2/d)}-21 > 1$. By Lemma 39, whp $|E_C| \ge \frac{dn}{2} - 2ne^{-d/3} \ge \frac{dn}{3}$, giving that $\frac{w_C(F)}{Z_C^{\text{dis}}} < q^{-n[\eta/20-e^{-d/3}]}$. For all $d$ large enough, this is at most $q^{-n\eta/30}$. Aggregating over at most $2^{|E_C|} \le 2^{dn}$ configurations $F$, we get that $\pi_C^{\text{dis}}(B_1) \le e^{-n}$ for all $q$ large enough.
